name: coordinate

coordinate verb
(COMBINE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] to make many different things work effectively as a whole: We need someone to coordinate the whole campaign. A number of charities are coordinating their efforts to distribute food to the region.
More examplesFewer examplesRight now I'm having problems co-ordinating thought and speech.They co-ordinated diaries and made the event happen.

coordinate verb
(MATCH)
[ I ] UK to match or look attractive together: coordinate with The bed linen coordinates with the bedroom curtains. a coordinating jacket and skirt
More examplesFewer examplesOne approach is to decide on a colour theme, perhaps to co-ordinate with the room in which the pictures will hang.To co-ordinate with the modern kitchen, the cooker is finished in dove grey. Take a lightweight jacket and co-ordinating trousers or skirt.

coordinate noun
(POSITION)
[ C usually plural ] one of a pair of numbers and/or letters that show the exact position of a point on a map or graph: Put in the GPS coordinates and zoom in on the map. The pilot had been given the wrong co-ordinates. Students learn the fundamentals of graphs and how X and Y coordinates work.
More examplesFewer examplesUsers can download the coordinates and find out how far they are from the nearest supply.They use GPS to lock in the helicopter's co-ordinates while flying over a field so they can easily return to exactly the same spot.I took a note of the co-ordinates for the rendezvous.
